nodes.text: If the Senate does agree to the legislation, Connecticut becomes the first state to voluntarily establish civil unions.
So laws passed by the legislature are 'state approved' while rulings of the courts are not? The media portrayal of gay rights is always awful.
I think most Americans are not against Civil Unions for gays so this is no big deal, besides I think Vermont already has approved Civil Unions.....
and how do you know this......oh I see...you said 'I think'....but you don't really 'know' what most Americans favor or don't favor...you just 'think'
